alert.note: Alert for Cuyama Valley; San Luis Obispo County Beaches; San Luis Obispo County Inland Central Coast; San Luis Obispo County Interior Valleys; San Luis Obispo County Mountains; Santa Barbara County Central Coast Beaches; Santa Barbara County Inland Central Coast; Santa Barbara County Interior Mountains; Santa Lucia Mountains; Santa Ynez Valley; Southern Salinas Valley (California) Issued by the National Weather Service

info.headline: Special Weather Statement issued June 05 at 9:56PM PDT by NWS Oxnard
info.description: ...A strong thunderstorm will impact portions of northwestern Santa Barbara and San Luis Obispo Counties through 1100 PM PDT... At 955 PM PDT, Doppler radar was tracking a a line of thunderstorms across souther San Luis Opispo county. Movement was southwest at 15 mph. HAZARD...Wind gusts up to 50 mph and pea size hail, along with brief heavy downpours and frequent lightning. SOURCE...Radar indicated. IMPACT...Gusty winds could knock down tree limbs and blow around unsecured objects. Locations impacted include... Santa Maria, San Luis Obispo, Morro Bay, Pismo Beach, Atascadero, Arroyo Grande, Nipomo, Orcutt, Cuyama, Grover Beach, Guadalupe, Sisquoc, Oceano, Black Mountain, Santa Margarita, Carrizo Plain, Highway 166 between Twitchell Dam and the Cuyama Valley, Highway 101 over Cuesta Grade, Lake Lopez, and Shell Beach. MAX HAIL SIZE...0.00 IN MAX WIND GUST...50 MPH
info.instruction: If outdoors, consider seeking shelter inside a building.
